solution_line_template: If the magnet cost {sticker_ratio}-times more than the sticker, the sticker cost {magnet_cost}/{sticker_ratio}=1 dollar.
If the magnet cost {stuffed_animals_ratio} the price of the two stuffed animals combined, then two stuffed animals cost {magnet_cost}/{stuffed_animals_ratio}=12 dollars.

Thus, a single stuffed animal cost {two_stuffed_animals_cost}/{stuffed_animals_count}=<<{two_stuffed_animals_cost}/{stuffed_animals_count}={single_stuffed_animal_cost}>>{single_stuffed_animal_cost} dollars.
